title: Quiz - SchemesTap - 16th to 22nd July 2023
instruction: Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi (PM-KISAN) Scheme is a Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) Scheme, under which, direct financial assistance is provided to all landholding farmer families across the country, subject to certain exclusion criteria relating to higher income strata, to enable them to take care of expenses related to agriculture and allied activities as well as domestic needs.

quiz.text: Which of the following statement(s) is/are correct with respect to the above scheme? 1. ₹1 lakh crore to be disbursed by financial year 2023-24 and interest subvention and credit guarantee assistance will be given till the year 2032-33. 2. Interest Subvention on Loans is 7% per annum up to a limit of ₹2 crore. 3. Some of the beneficiaries are as Marketing Cooperative Societies, Self Help Groups, Joint Liability , Multipurpose Cooperative Societies. 4. Maximum Moratorium Period under the scheme is 2 years.
options: Only 1 and 3
Only 1, 2 and 3
Only 1 and 4
Only 3 and 4
Only 2, 3 and 4

quiz.text:
Which among the following(s) is/are eligible as Funding Institutions under the scheme mentioned in the above paragraph? 1. Prathaan is a Regional Rural Bank which is operating in one of villages of Uttar Pradesh for providing essential financial services to people of that area.
 2.  Payteam Payment Bank, which is expanding it's reach in recent months very rapidly.
 3. Neo which is operating as Small Finance Bank since 2020, expanding the reach of basic banking services across the country.
 4.  Scroll which is operating as Non-Banking Financial Company since its inception, helping thousands of lenders.
options: Only 2, 3 and 4
Only 1, 2 and 3
Only 1, 3 and 4
Only 1 and 4
All of the above

quiz.text: Which statement(s) among following is/are incorrect with respect to above scheme?1. For a private sector entity, such as farmer, agri entrepreneur, start-up there is limit of maximum of 20 projects2. Limitation of number of projects is also applicable to State agencies, cooperatives, national and state federations of cooperatives, FPOs, federations of FPOs, SHGs and federation of SHGs.3. Any grant or subsidy available under any present or future scheme of Central/State government can be availed for projects under this financing facility.
options: (A) Only 1 and 2
(B) Only 1
(C) Only 2
(D) Only 2 and 3
(E) None of the above

quiz.text: Which scheme has been described in the above passage?
options: Atal Bhujal Yojana
Jal Jeevan Mission
National Rural Drinking Water Programme
AMRUT 2.0
Swachh Bharat Mission (Gramin)

quiz.text:
Which of the following statement(s) is/are correct with respect to above scheme?
1. Community needs to contribute 5% or 10% of capital cost for in-village infrastructure as the case may be, in cash/ kind/ and/ or labour.
2. Every village to prepare a Village Action Plan (VAP) which will have two components.
3. Technological interventions to be provided for removal of contaminants where water quality is an issue.
4. Recently (May 2023) Mission Achieved Milestone Of 10 Crore Tap Water Connections.
options: (A) Only 1, 2 and 3
(B) Only 1 and 3
(C) Only 1, 2 and 4
(D) Only 3 and 4
(E) All of the above

quiz.text: Which statement(s) among the following is/are correct with respect to above scheme ? 1. Andaman and Nicobar Islands is among the Union Territories (UTs) that has reported 100% coverage under the scheme. 2. It targets to provide potable water at service level of 55 litre per capita per day through Functional Household Tap Connections (FHTC) by 2024. 3. While allocating the funds to States/ UTs 20% weightage has been given to the population residing in habitations affected by chemical contaminants including Arsenic and Fluoride.
options: (A) 1 and 2
(B) 1 and 3
(C) Only 1
(D) Only 2
(E) All of the above

quiz.text: Which among the following is/are incorrect with respect to incentives under the scheme described in above passage? A. Development Capital Support (DCS) is provided to investors to set up production facilities to incentivize manufacturing units to get established. B. Under DCS, Greenfield Park: support will be 30% of Project Cost, with a cap of ₹ 500 Crore per Park. C. Competitiveness Incentive Support (CIS) is used for creation of Core Infrastructures.
options: Only B
A and B
A, B and C
A and C
None of the above

quiz.text: Above scheme is inspired by the 5F vision of Prime Minister of India, what does 5F stand for?
options: Farm to Fibre to Factory to Foreign to Fashion
Fibre to Farm to Factory to Fashion to Foreign
Farm to Fibre to Factory to Fashion to Foreign
Farm to Factory to Fibre to Fashion to Foreign
Farm to Fibre to Fashion to Factory to Foreign

quiz.text: Which of the following statement/s is/are correct with respect to the above Scheme? A. 1st PM MITRA Park is to be established in Virudhunagar District of Telangana. B. Parks will be developed by a Special Purpose Vehicle which will be owned by State Government (49%) and Government of India (51%) in a Public Private Partnership (PPP) Mode. C. Parks are setup on the basis of proposals received from State Governments having ready availability of contiguous and encumbrance-free land parcel of minimum 1000 acres.
options: A and B
Only B
Only A
Only C
A, B and C

quiz.text: Which of the following statement/s is/are correct with respect to the Scheme for Development of Solar parks and Ultra-Mega Solar Power Projects?A. Ministry of New & Renewable Energy is the nodal ministry for the scheme.B. It was launched in the year 2014.C. It is valid till 2023-24.
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: The Scheme for Development of Solar parks and Ultra-Mega Solar Power Projects aims to set up _________ of solar power installed capacity.
options: 10,000 MW
20,000 MW
30,000 MW
40,000 MW
50,000 MW

quiz.text: With respect to the National Green Hydrogen Mission, which of the following options is incorrect?
options: Mission aims to make India a Global Hub for production, utilization and export of Green Hydrogen and its derivatives.
PHASE I of the mission will be implemented from 2022-23 TO 2025-26.
The financial outlay for the Mission is Rs.15,744 crore.
Ministry of New and Renewable Energy is the Nodal Ministry of the mission.
All are correct.

quiz.text: Which of the following statements is/are the target/s to be achieved by 2030 under National Green Hydrogen Mission? A. Development of Green Hydrogen Production capacity of at least 5 MMT per annum B. Cumulative reduction in fossil fuel imports over Rs. 2 lakh crore C. Abatement of nearly 50 MMT of annual greenhouse gas emissions
options: Only A
Only B
Both A and B
Both A and C
All of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following statements is/are correct with respect to the National Green Hydrogen Mission?
options: Under the Strategic Interventions for Green Hydrogen Transition Programme (SIGHT), 2 distinct financial incentive mechanisms will be provided.
The Mission will not support pilot projects in emerging end-use sectors and production pathways.
A public-private partnership framework for R&D (Strategic Hydrogen Innovation Partnership – SHIP) will be facilitated under the Mission.
Only A and C
All of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following statements is/are correct with respect to the above scheme?A. It is being implemented by Ministry of Civil Aviation.B. It was launched in the year 2015.C. Airports Authority of India is the implementing agency for the scheme.
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following statements is/are correct with respect to the above scheme? A. The scheme gives special focus to hilly states only. B. The scheme would be in operation for a period of 15 years. C. Landing charges, parking charges and Terminal Navigation Landing Charges will be imposed for RCS flights etc.
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: What is the fare at which the airlines have to sell tickets a specific number of seats for 1 hour of flying as per the scheme mentioned in the above paragraph?
options: Rs 2,000
Rs 2,500
Rs 3,000
Rs 3,500
Rs 4,000

quiz.text:
Which of the following is/are the key features of the above discussed scheme?

a. It is a Central Sector Scheme.

b. The entire responsibility of identification of beneficiary farmer families’ rests with the State / UT Governments.

c. An amount of Rs 8000 per year in four equal instalments of Rs 2,000 each (every three months) is released by the Central Government online.
options: a and b only
b and c only
a and c only
a, b and c
None of the Above

quiz.text:
Which of the following statements is/are correct with respect to eligibility criterion under above Scheme?

A. Only Small & Marginal Farmers’ families, with combined landholding up to 2 hectares are eligible

B. Institutional land holders are not eligible under this scheme

C. Superannuated employees availing monthly pension of Rs. 10,000 or more are not eligible
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following statements is incorrect with respect to above scheme?
options: Farmers in villages situated in urban areas are not eligible under scheme
Micro land holdings, which are not cultivable, are excluded from PM KISAN
Agricultural land being used for non-agricultural purposes is not covered
Aadhar based eKYC is mandatory for PM KISAN registered farmers.
Family comprises of husband, wife and minor children who own cultivable land as per land records of the concerned State/UT

quiz.text:
Which of the following statement is/are correct with respect to above scheme?

A. Tenant farmers are considered eligible beneficiaries under the scheme

B. The scheme is being administered by Ministry of Finance

C. Cut-off date for determination of eligibility is 01 Feb 2019, and no changes thereafter shall be considered for eligibility for next 4 years
options: A and C
B and C
A and B
None of the above
A, B and C
